image.altText: Powerlines on farmland in front of a mountain range.

props.synopsis: The fate of the contentious Marinus Link project lies in the hands of hundreds of Tasmanian landowners, some of whom are welcoming the financial compensation. For others, it's a different story.

title.children: Powerline payouts like a lotto win for some farmers, but others won't budge

image.altText: Scott Riley stands next to a road in Queenstown

props.synopsis: A regional Tasmanian council has lost nearly a third of its staff, with the union representing staff putting the council "on notice" to address a number of issues.

title.children: General manager defends West Coast Council amid staff exodus

image.altText: A portable electric heater on the floor with a person's feet warming up next to it

props.synopsis: The federal government says its new Solar Sharer scheme will also benefit Australians who aren't able to access it, but some experts are hesitant to agree.

title.children: Why Tasmania misses out on three free hours of power a day under federal plan

image.altText: A large, roofed circular stadium near Hobart's CBD, seen from the air.

props.synopsis: After years of talk, the process to decide the fate of the contentious $1.13 billion stadium at Macquarie Point is finally under way. Here's how it will all unfold.

title.children: Hobart stadium order tabled in parliament — here's what happens next

image.altText: Sunrise over a silhouetted jetty and calm water.

props.synopsis: For some residents of Tasmania's east coast, it is either leave the region or risk being homeless as they grapple with a scarcity of long-term rentals.

title.children: 'The very best place in Australia' is running out of homes

image.altText: A black and white photograph of a glacier from satellite imagery.

props.synopsis: Antarctic scientists have documented the fastest retreat of a glacier in modern history, after it lost eight kilometres of ice in just two months, according to a new report.

title.children: Antarctic glacier shrinks at fastest pace in modern history

image.altText: A man dressed in a suit leans out of a car window.

props.synopsis: Widely regarded as one of the most influential vice-presidents in history, Mr Cheney was a driving force behind the US invasion of Iraq in 2003.

title.children: Former US vice-president Dick Cheney dies aged 84

image.altText: A mobile icon of the Reddit app.

props.synopsis: Reddit and Kick will be included in the world-first social media ban for children under 16, which begins next month.

title.children: Reddit and Kick added to child social media ban

image.altText: Picture of Australian one dollar coins stacked on top of note currency

props.synopsis: The corporate regulator is threatening Australia's nascent private lending industry with tighter regulation if it does not see a significant lift in standards.

title.children: Private lending, public exposure. Why ASIC is worried

image.altText: Elon Musk holding his hands up to his mouth.

props.synopsis: The world's largest sovereign wealth fund holds the seventh biggest stake in the electric car maker, and is so far the biggest shareholder to say how it plans to vote.

title.children: Elon Musk's $1.5 trillion Tesla pay deal set to be rejected by Norway wealth fund

image.altText: Uniformed Thai soldiers escort people out of security vehicles.

props.synopsis: A Shenzhen court has sentenced five people to death for their involvement in a violent criminal gang with fraud operations in Myanmar, Chinese state media says.

title.children: Five sentenced to death in China for role in Myanmar scam centres

image.altText: A tattered missing person poster with a young man smiling on a telegraph pole.

props.synopsis: New York political candidate Petros Krommidas went missing at a beach five months ago, but he could still win a seat in Nassau County.

title.children: New York political candidate who vanished five months ago could still win

image.altText: A mine site near a road and bushland, as seen from above.

props.synopsis: The future of a NSW coal mine remains unclear after its holding company entered administration, with the mine owing more than $250 million, including almost $30 million in unpaid royalties.

title.children: Administrators called in for owner of mine owing almost $30m in royalties

image.altText: Jamie Kah smiles, in jockey outfit as she rides a horse at Flemington Racecourse.

props.synopsis: When eight-year-old Jamie started riding lessons on her little pony named Bessie, she hoped she would one day win the coveted Melbourne Cup.

title.children: Why Jamie Melham's Melbourne Cup win was 'like a fairytale come true'

image.altText: A plate with a smattering of green beans and beef Wellington, and a knife and fork.

props.synopsis: Intermittent fasting can have health benefits, but does being hungry affect our cognitive abilities? Here's what all the evidence tells us.

title.children: Does fasting dull your mental edge? We crunched the data for the best advice

image.altText: An aeroplane looks microscopic when silhouetted by a supermoon.

props.synopsis: The difference from other full moons won't be all that noticeable to the naked eye, but you can enhance the viewing experience if you pick the right time and vantage point.

title.children: The 'beaver' full moon will be the the closest supermoon of the year. Here's how to see it

image.altText: David Beckham holding a King's Birthday Honours medal.

props.synopsis: The world-famous footballer was handed the honour, for services to sport and charity, at a ceremony at Windsor Castle.

title.children: David Beckham receives knighthood in 'big moment' for ex-footballer

image.altText: Sheetal Devi has no arms and is shooting her arrow from her bow with her feet.

props.synopsis: Growing up in Jammu and Kashmir to a humble farmer family, Devi's father says she found her own way to do everything — including learning to shoot a bow with astonishing precision.

title.children: Born without arms, Sheetal Devi learned to shoot with her feet. She's now a world champion

image.altText: A generic image of a red Australian rules ball.

props.synopsis: A suburban Perth football club is suspended from its league for two years after a "severe breach" of integrity standards, following an end-of-season costume stunt that left City of Stirling workers distressed.

title.children: Stephen Hawking costume sees Perth football club banned for two years

image.altText: A sunset on a river with boats

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting pleasant conditions across most of Queensland, with only isolated showers possible along the state’s northern coast.

title.children: Severe storms subside leaving Queensland 'bathed in sunshine'

image.altText: A portable electric heater on the floor with a person's feet warming up next to it

props.synopsis: The federal government says its new Solar Sharer scheme will also benefit Australians who aren't able to access it, but some experts are hesitant to agree.

title.children: Why Tasmania misses out on three free hours of power a day under federal plan

image.altText: Reserve Bank of Australia

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank has kept interest rates on hold at 3.6pc after hotter-than-expected inflation in the September quarter squashed hopes of a rate cut.

title.children: RBA keeps rates on hold in November at 3.6pc

image.altText: A centrlink sign through a bush.

props.synopsis: Fugitives wanted for some of the most serious crimes and sexual offences could soon be stripped of their welfare payments.

title.children: Fears fugitive welfare cut-off will capture innocent people

image.altText: A street sign that reads "Wall St". A US flag is visible behind it.

props.synopsis: Last week the RBA governor issued a blunt warning on the state of financial markets and as markets continue to shift from traditional valuation methods, plenty of cool heads are getting nervous.

title.children: A key measure of stock market health is now flashing red

image.altText: Conjoined newborn twins lie amongst blankets in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: The mother of a rare set of conjoined twins is begging doctors to explore other options after a Papua New Guinea hospital recommended against sending the infants overseas for surgery.

title.children: Not the end of the road for PNG conjoined twins, hospital says

image.altText: bluey drawing a picture

props.synopsis: The federal government puts laws requiring streaming services to produce Australian content back on the table after a hiatus following the US election.

title.children: Streaming services to be made to produce Australian content

image.altText: A woman with long wavy brown hair, wearing a navy lace top, standing in a suburban street.

props.synopsis: I want to reflect on what I have come to see, through my own experience, as both the illuminating strengths and the shadowed weaknesses of the Australian legal system and its role in our democracy.

title.children: At the heart of the constitution, there lies an historic and structural wound

image.altText: A man smiling.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has thrust the Democrats into the political wilderness but an uprising in the gritty streets of New York may be their future.

title.children: Why a 'radical' Democrat socialist is causing waves in the United States

image.altText: A close-up of a bag of blue pills, held by hands in blue gloves.

props.synopsis: Police charge 18 people in Perth and Sydney and seize 268 kilograms of illicit drugs following a multi-agency investigation into a national crime syndicate.

title.children: 'Put them out of business': Police seize $60 million of drugs in major bust

image.altText: Sunrise over a silhouetted jetty and calm water.

props.synopsis: For some residents of Tasmania's east coast, it's either leave the region or risk being homeless as they grapple with a scarcity in long-term rentals.

title.children: 'The very best place in Australia' is running out of homes

image.altText: man with white wound dressings around his eye helps carry a coffin on a metal scaffold. marigold flowes on coffin.

props.synopsis: A passenger who walked from a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crash that killed his brother soon after take-off tells UK media of the mental and physical anguish he has endured since.

title.children: Lone survivor of Air India crash says 'God took all my happiness'

image.altText: A hill with a coal mine cut out of the side.

props.synopsis: BHP will transfer 3,700 hectares of land at the Mt Arthur coal mine to a neighbouring mining company looking to expand its operations, raising questions about its promise to close the mine by 2030.

title.children: BHP accused of backflipping on closure of NSW's biggest coal mine

image.altText: Police push back an angry crowd of protesters

props.synopsis: Dozens of demonstrators from Palestine Action Group rallied outside the Sydney International Convention Centre on Tuesday morning.

title.children: Twelve charged after pro-Palestinian protesters clash with police at defence expo

image.altText: Jofra Archer on the cricket field pointing with both hands, Ben Stokes rests his hands on JArcher's shoulders

props.synopsis: England is urged to play both Jofra Archer and Mark Wood to begin the Ashes in Perth despite durability concerns with both quicks.

title.children: Aussie great urges England to unleash pacemen despite injury concerns
